title: Fill space between plates with insulating slab

content.description: A capacitor is constructed of two large, identical, parallel metal plates separated by a small distance d. A battery fully charges the capacitor and is then disconnected.
content.question: If, instead of separating the plates, the empty space between the plates is filled with a slab of insulating material that has a dielectric constant K = 2, which of the following correctly describes the change, if any, of the voltage across the capacitor, the electric field between the plates, and the energy stored in the capacitor?

choices.label:
Voltage
 Electric Field
 Energy

Halves
 Halves
 Halves

Voltage
 Electric Field
 Energy

Halves
 Halves
 Does not change

Voltage
 Electric Field
 Energy

Does not change
 Does not change
 Halves

Voltage
 Electric Field
 Energy

Does not change
 Halves
 Halves

Voltage
 Electric Field
 Energy

Does not change
 Does not change
 Does not change

content.answer:
Voltage
 Electric Field
 Energy

Halves
 Halves
 Halves

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
